demo.simple_grid_graph_demo package

Submodules

demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo module

demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.rewardCallback(values)[source]

This is a callback function that defines the reward provided to the robotic agent. Note: this function has to be adopted to the current experimental design. This is flexible enough to accommodate for different experimental setups.

values: a dict of values that are transferred from the OAI module to the reward function.

reward : reward value stopEpisode: flag set to true/false

demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.trialBeginCallback(trial, rlAgent)[source]

This is a callback function that is called in the beginning of each trial. Here, experimental behavior can be defined (ABA renewal and the like).

trial: the number of the finished trial rlAgent: the employed reinforcement learning agent

None

demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.trialEndCallback(trial, rlAgent, logs)[source]

This is a callback routine that is called when a single trial ends. Here, functionality for performance evaluation can be introduced.

trial: the number of the finished trial rlAgent: the employed reinforcement learning agent logs: output of the reinforcement learning subsystem

None

demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.singleRun()[source]

This method performs a single experimental run, i.e. one experiment. It has to be called by either a parallelization mechanism (without visual output), or by a direct call (in this case, visual output can be used).

combinations: this is a combination of parameters used for a single experiment. Note: the combination values depend on the experimental design!

None

None

demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo_with_rotation module

demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo_with_rotation.visualOutput = True

this function has to be adopted to the current experimental design.

values: a dict of values that are transferred from the OAI module to the reward function. This is flexible enough to accommodate for different experimental setups.

Type

This is a callback function that defines the reward provided to the robotic agent. Note
